availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Dupee (Free black Baptist pastor in Lexington, Fayette Co)

body.p: Residence: Lexington, KY and Paducah, KY. Born into slavery in Gallatin County, KY, son of Cuthbert and Rachael Dupee. Pastor of Lexington, Kentucky's Pleasant Green Baptist Church. His congregation purchased his freedom in 1856. Became pastor of Washington Street Colored Baptist Church in Paducah, KY in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 2, p. 132.

Find A Grave, Entry for Rev. George Washington "Pappy" Dupee (1827-1897), Find A Grave Memorial # 83942189, Oak Grove Cemetery, Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=83942189 (accessed 27 May 2017).
"George W Dupee," Notable Kentucky African Americans Database, University of Kentucky Libraries, http://nkaa.uky.edu/record.php?note_id=1195 (accessed 27 May 2017).
